title.narrative: HCFC Phase-out Management Plan for Botswana

description.narrative: During the 19th Meeting of the Parties to the Montreal Protocol, Parties adopted Decision XIX/6 aimed at accelerating the phasing out of production and consumption of the Hydrochlorofluorocarbons (HCFCs). Based on this Decision, Parties stipulated under Article 5 of the Montreal Protocol are obligated to develop a framework for total HCFC phase-out by 2030. The framework shall adopt staged approach reflecting on the HCFC baseline freeze in 2013, the 10% and 35 % reductions in 2015 and 2020 respectively. Botswana became Party to the Montreal Protocol on 02 March, 1992 and the consumption of CFCs was totally phased out before the 2010 target year while that of HCFC decreased in 2011 and slightly decreased from 2012 to 2013.
